thread.title: Redskins-Eagles could be moved to Week 8 due to Hurricane Joaquin
thread.title_full: Redskins-Eagles could be moved to Week 8 due to Hurricane Joaquin - CBSSports.com

author: John Breech
title: Redskins-Eagles could be moved to Week 8 due to Hurricane Joaquin
text:
If Hurricane Joaquin makes its way to the East Coast this weekend, the nasty weather could force the NFL to postpone Sunday's game between the Eagles and Redskins that's scheduled to be played at FedEx Field. 

The latest from SportsLine Power Ratings: Are the Falcons for real? 

CBS Sports NFL Insider Jason La Canfora has reported that the league is currently trying to figure out what to do if the hurricane hits, and that postponing the game would likely be the "easiest" option. 
Both the Redskins and Eagles have a bye in Week 8 and if the game were to be postponed, that's likely when it would be made up. According to La Canfora, a decision about the game could come by Saturday, when the Eagles are expected to start heading for DC. 
If the game's postponed, both teams would get a bye this week and then see each other on Nov. 1. The Redskins and Eagles also have a game in Philadelphia on Dec. 26. 
If the game is postponed, it wouldn't be the first time that weather has caused a game to move.
Last season, a Bills game that was scheduled to be played on a Sunday in Buffalo was moved to a Monday in Detroit to due a snow emergency in the Buffalo area. 

FedEx Field might not be hosting a game on Sunday. (USATSI) 

Topics: Buffalo Bills , Philadelphia Eagles , Washington Redskins , NFL
